subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Not to be a wet blanket
author: Debbie Tejada
full_text:
Hi Bruce,

I got up this morning with almost 50 emails in my inbox! I did read  
all the emails and listen to the clips. I'm new at this box stuff (and  
don't have one of my own), so what I do is listen to the clips first  
to see if I can pick out any words and then look at the clip name to  
see if I'm correct. The new files posted by you and Juli were great  
and I think I'm starting to train my ears, because I was hearing what  
the file names indicated.

I've mentioned a couple of times how excited I am to have joined this  
forum, a lot of really intelligent, interesting and dedicated members!  
I've belonged to other forums relating to different subjects  
(software, african greys, etc.) and this forum is definitely more  
active than most and I'm starting to get familiar with the regulars.

Yes, you'll get a bunch of reactions to your post (below)! The  
Internet is a wonderful thing, to be able to connect people with the  
same interests despite their physical distances. Hmmmm, sounds a bit  
like Frank's Boxes to me . . . quantum entanglement anyone???

Now I'd better get some work done.
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

Debbie Tejada


"Once you can accept the universe as matter expanding into nothing  
that is something, wearing stripes with plaid comes easy. "  ~Albert  
Einstein

On Jan 3, 2008, at 8:14 AM, bhali333 wrote:

> But ,
>
> yesterday I posted like 20 files and did not recieve one reply on any
> of them.
>
> Yet a post about a broken cell phone recieves a hundred replies.
> What is this group about?
>
> Frank is right what the hell is the sense of posting files to an EVP- 
> ITC
> group if no one pays attention to the evp's or files that are posted.
>
> I admit I do not reply to every single post myself but I do try and
> reply to most.
>
> If no one is even bothering to listen to the files you are really
> missing what this is all about.
>
> Come o9n guy's this is supposed to be about the exchange of ideas and
> constructive suggestions on evp-itc research. It's not a chat board or
> a forum for personal vendeta's
>
> Let's get with the program and do some evp work.
>
> And I'll bet I get some replies to this post that's for sure !
>
> Bruce
>
>
>
